@dan_abramov I have a whole list of friend I value and love here but here‚Äôs the thread I guess lmao

In no specific order EXCEPT MY OTHER BRAIN CEL @yuricodesbot 

Special shoutout to my first follower @pokecoder and my friend and mentor @theCoachNico. Also my best friend @Mansourabv 

Anyway

On a mission to find the most insightful twitter account

Tag the first account you can think of that's more insightful than you. If you get tagged, do the same underneath.
@dan_abramov @buildsghos, very impressed by the technical knowledge, and the analysis capacities. Every single tweet they make create a brain connection. Source of inspiration for me.
@saraliDev @dan_abramov @J_Lieu @DThompsonDev @danielcranney @shashiwhocodes I need to host a tech event for all of us!
@dan_abramov @J_Lieu @DeniTechh @DThompsonDev @danielcranney @shashiwhocodes and many more of the amazing people I follow ‚ú®
@kishore_kch @dan_abramov Thanks! We try to spot underrated tweets and tweeters

@jarredsumner The benefit of import maps as a linking mechanism is that they are a common currency that can be shared with browsers, unlike node_modules. So it provides a future convergence point.

In the worst case, import maps may need to be regenerated based off those other files for now.

If you work in tech, #TechTwitter is the place to learn, keep up to date and get inspired.

Follow the right people and you learn something new every day.

Here are 20 tech folks I always pay attention to. They tweet no fluff. Plus details on what to expect when following them:
@RyanCarniato @t3dotgg @zBrianW @dan_abramov @Steve8708 Also @RyanCarniato but we're probably not supposed to recurse here.
@zachleat @JLarky @dan_abramov @Rich_Harris It can still be used for good.
@JLarky @dan_abramov @RyanCarniato @Rich_Harris how insightful do we need to be to spot a thinly veiled popularity contest üòÖ
@dan_abramov In webdev? @RyanCarniato, @Rich_Harris and @zachleat come to mind :)
